item.title: Alright chums! I've got one question, then I'm GONE FOR GOOD. :D
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

If you stop saying “chums” and “brobro” and “:D” then people will be much more willing to help you.

Read full topic

item.title: Alright chums! I've got one question, then I'm GONE FOR GOOD. :D
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“PloxScape, post:3, topic:535239”][quote author=ultimatepkvillage link=topic=654041.msg4381278#msg4381278 date=1383624967]
It goes in client.java or cachedownloader.java - if that file exists client sided.
Search for

public static final String cacheLink = "PASTE HERE DOWNLOAD LINK"; //make sure it zip
Signlink is just were your telling the cache path to unzip at and quit saying were chums when you can’t even do simple stuff. And you uploaded cache as a rar instead of a zip file
[/quote]

Your hostility is bringing me down. ._. I call everyone chum in the real life and in the virtual world brobro.[/quote]
Hostility? I see no sign.

Read full topic

item.title: Alright chums! I've got one question, then I'm GONE FOR GOOD. :D
item.dc:creator: @PloxScape PloxScape
item.description:
@PloxScape wrote:

[B]I’m wondering where I should put my cache download link thingy ma’bobber since I’m using Dropbox.

I know you search for findcachedir() and then this comes up:

} Sequence musicS = null; public static final String findcachedir(){ do { String string; try { String string_0_ = "cache"; String string_1_ = "./"; File file = new File(new StringBuilder().append(string_1_).append(string_0_).toString()); if(!file.exists() && !file.mkdir()) break; string = new StringBuilder().append(string_1_).append(string_0_).append("/").toString(); } catch(Exception exception){ break; } return string; } while(false); return null; }

But where do I ever put the DL link, which is:

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/um2x6hh8mc5v783/cache.rar?dl=1&token_hash=AAHFuzIRl6f8-iq2L2PomH1rj0c0raSIBESnM32VdwZfgA

Where does I put it? o:[/B]

Read full topic
